answers.answer: Why does he want to induce u??
He didn't say, he just said if I dont have her before the 26th he wants to induce me.

Wow i got indused with my first kid im on number five i dont think its bad i didnt have any problems an ur baby will be fully developed?? But hopefully ur baby comes naturally before that day..  how many babys do u have/? Or is this ur first??
I will be 39 weeks &&' 2 days on the 26th.

I would ask why the induction before scheduling the induction. I'm a firm believer in the longer the baby cooks the better baby is. Unless you are high risk or there is something going on with baby of course
Alright, My next apt is on the 16th. I'll be sure to ask him why he wants to induce me. I didn't really get a chance to ask him today, he told me as I was walking out the door -.-
Same with me. Im due jan 2nd and im also getting induced on the 26th.
My sister was induced and she almost died. Her uterus didn't go back in place and she started bleeding extremely bad. Idk if was from being induced tho

I was in your shoes in 2003 but my son was due Jan 07, 04. I was induced because I retained too much water in a week. Induction can be risky and I heard hurts more than going in naturally. I'm finally pregnant with a little girl and I'm trying to be strong and go naturally. She's due Dec 12th. I would suggest not to do the induction unless you have to, and since you're a ftm the doc will say anything to scare you. I watched a documentary called business of being born. It opened my eyes to so much. I recommend it. (:

I was induced a week early with my second child. The doctor asked if I wanted to be induced and I was having so many complications that I was just ready to get the baby out and be done with it,  so i opted to be induced. It all went smoothly,  and my son came out healthy,  but having gone the natural route with my first born, I realized that I much preferred just letting nature take its course, and will be having baby number 3 whenever the baby decides to make its entrance.  There are pro's and cons to being induced,  but ultimately it is your choice,  not the doctors, so do not let him pressure you into anything.

It's far better to let baby come on its own if you are not having complications. If there is no medical need for it, I'd refuse. It's possible he has plans or a vacation coming up and wants to get you delivered before. It happens far too often.

i would refuse if there isnt a valid medical reason for it. maybe your dr. has vacation plans but doesnt want to miss out on your birth and the $$. another reason why i prefer midwives. they plan there vacation time a year on advance and you only get midwives assigned to you that are 100% available for you for your birth so its not some stranger delivering your baby. i would definitely have a chat with the dr next appointment and confirm his reasoning for wanting to the induction.

Sounds like your doctor doesnt want to miss out on their new years plans. They scheduledit the day after christmas but before new years......unless there is a real reason, i wouldnt do it. Baby needs as much time as possible. My level 2 peri wanted to induce my first one at 37 weeks, i delclined until week 40. What if the weeks are off, and your actually less far behind.....baby needs all the time they can have! Good luck! Plus, i feared not being ready and ending in a c-section.
Thanks for all of yalls advice, it was really helpful.

You could have preeclampsia or your liver could be shutting down.  He can notice that stuff with a urine sample and weight gain and blood pressure.   Doctors don't like to induce unless its needed for you or your babies safety.  I feel as long as you make it to 36weeks you will have a healthy baby just smaller.
If your doctor didn't want to miss out on a vacation you would think they would induce you right be for Christmas not right after.  Just talk to your doctor
I was induced four times. High blood pressure. I don't know any different but it didnt seem to be horrible. They were each my birth story and had no complications from being induced. Good luck.

Just make sure your Dr isn't doing it because he wants to have his New Years party - Some Dr's will do that!And I totally agree, especially with your 1st, baby should come when baby wants. Inductions raise your risk of a c section which affects every birth you have after this one.  Just be smart about it. Good luck!

question: I'm 35 weeks. I had a doctors apt today && found out he wants to induce me on the 26th of this month. I just wanted to know, is it a bad thing he wants to induce me early? Cause I wasn't supposed to be due till Jan. 2nd
title: Getting Induced
